concept.title: Cache behavior
concept.shortdesc: The implementation specific features of the instruction and data caches include:

ul.li: At reset the instruction and data caches are disabled and both caches are automatically invalidated.

section.note: Caches in the core are d automatically at reset deassertion unless the power mode is initialized to Debug Recovery. See the word class="- topic/key ">Arm DynamIQ Shared Unit Technical Reference Manual for more information.

ul.li: You can enable or disable each cache independently.
On a cache miss, data for the cache linefill is requested in critical -first order.

link.desc: If the instruction cache is disabled, fetches cannot access any of the instruction cache arrays. An exception is the instruction cache maintenance operations. If the instruction cache is disabled, the instruction cache maintenance operations can still execute normally.
Instruction fetches are speculative, as there can be several unresolved branches in the pipeline. There is no execution guarantee.
If the data cache is disabled, load and store instructions do not access any of the L1 data, L2 cache, and, if present, the DSU L3 cache arrays.
DC IVAC operations in AArch64 state are treated as DC CIVAC except for permission checking and watchpoint matching.
To maintain data coherency between multiple cores, the Cortexâ€‘A76 core uses the MESI protocol.
A cache line is allocated to the L1 on either a read miss or a write miss.
